intro: Senecio prainianus, commonly known as the Prain's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Senecio prainianus is often found in regions with a subtropical or tropical climate.
